snippet: The corruption allegations against his son were a serious blow for the chief justice, Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry, who until now has been virtually venerated by many Pakistanis.
abstract: Pakistani businessman Malik Riaz Hussain testifies of being blackmailed for kickbacks by Arsalan Iftikhar, son of the country's powerful chief justice Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry; Hussain, speaking at Iftikhar's trial, claims that he made payments in return for favorable treatment in court; accusations are a major blow to Chaudry, who until now has been virtually venerated by many Pakistanis as a champion of justice.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

lead_paragraph: The corruption allegations against his son were a serious blow for the chief justice, Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry, who until now has been virtually venerated by many Pakistanis.

headline.seo: Pakistan’s Chief Justice Chaudhry Tainted by Son’s Trial
headline.main: Trial of Son Taints Pakistan’s Venerated Chief Justice
headline.print_headline: Trial of Son Taints Pakistan’s Venerated Chief Justice
